title: Amphidont
description: A piece I did for the Tira speculative evolution project.
medium: Watercolor and Copic on paper.  Later transformed with Adobe Illustrator into digital art.

title: Nature Morte
description: A charcoal drawing of mine from way back when.

title: Color
description: Two abstract pieces from my sketchbook.
medium: Copics on paper. Don't quite remember what was used on the left.

title: Leptopod and Parasites
description: A piece I did for the Tira speculative evolution project.
medium: Copics on paper. Later transformed with Adobe Illustrator into digital art.

title: Zoo
description: The biggest piece of paper I have filled with monster drawings.

title: Bleeding Imprints
description: One of my favourite experiments with melting printer ink onto paper.

title: Shonohonoh
description: A marine bird that converged with orcas. Often attacks fishermen by jumping onto their boats.

title: Tlanak
description: My attempt at a more surreal alien. The memories of this creature are imprinted into its various shells.

title: Ugmaruk
description: A fictional kind of beetle, used as a mount by the royal guard in this imaginary world.

title: Uhlezil
description: A hypothetical descendant of octopus that looks suspiciously like an elephant.

title: Aquatic Creatures
description: A marine assortment of various animals and that sort of thing.

title: Hammer Time
description: A multimedia piece from my high school art class.

title: Ink Monsters
description: A pair of monsters from my sketchbook.

title: Cosmic Body
description: A piece from my final project in an art class I took at Drew.
